TextBody:
Hello,

Do you have an audit log backup process scheduled ?
The first step is to make sure that you have an audit log backup process scheduled from server UI > System Maintenance > Audit Log Backup, as can be seen in the following example (e.g. frequency every week, target logs older than 1 month). 

This will archive periodically the logs/ events which are older than the configured threshold. Make sure to save changes by clicking the Schedule button:



Afterwards if the issue persists let me know your timezone and availability for a remote session using Zoom.

Best regards,
Alin
ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BkVnF:ref
Subject: Disk Space Issue    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BkVnF:ref ]

TextBody:
Hello,

Once the backup process finishes to archive logs you will see a new entry under System Maintenance - Audit Log Backup - Backup List, where you will be able to download the log archive if you need it.
Only the support team has ssh acesss to the server. Once the audit log backup finishes, let me know your timezone and availability for a remote session using Zoom if you'd like to expand the disk size.

Thank you and Best regards,
Alin

Are you available today at 3 or 4 pm BST for a Zoom session ?
As best practice, please make sure that you create a snapshot for the epp server VM from the virtualization tool/ cloud where the server is hosted, prior to the meeting.

Best regards,
Alin

TextBody:
Hello,

I'm adding a summary.
We expanded the main disk partition and made a change in the backend so that the log pertaining to events forwarded to your SIEM, gets archived.
Let us know when we can close this ticket.

Thank you,
Alin
